description: From Scots cleck, from Old Norse klekja.

verbs.description: cleck (third-person singular simple present clecks, present participle clecking, simple past and past participle clecked)

entries.meaning: (chiefly Scotland, transitive) To hatch (a bird); (colloquial) to give birth to (a person).
examples: Poor he might be, but the creature wasn't yet clecked that might put on its airs with him, John Guthrie.
